member.summary: Identifies the bindable property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.Series.Legend
member.summary: Gets or sets a legend for the current series object.
member.remarks:
If the Legend property is not set, the series will use the setting according to the parent XamDataChart's Legend property.
This is generally expressed as an element name binding, as the Legend must exist at some other position in the layout. This property only indicates which Legend to use and will not alone cause the legend to be visible.

member.name: M:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.Series.GetExactItemIndex(Xamarin.Forms.Point)
member.summary: Gets the precise item index, if possible, based on the closeness to the previous or next whole integer. If the series cannot provide this information, GetExactItemIndex will return the same integer value as GetItemIndex.
member.param: The world position for which to return the index.
member.returns: The double index indicating which whole number index the point is closest to.

member.name: M:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.Series.GetExactItemIndexFromSeriesPixel(Xamarin.Forms.Point)
member.summary: Gets the precise item index, if possible, the closeness to the previous or next whole integer indicating which value is closer. If the series cannot provide this information this will return the same integer value as GetItemIndexFromSeriesPixel.
member.param: The pixel position within the series plot area
member.returns: The exact item index, as a double, indicating which whole number index the mouse is closest to, if possible.

member.summary: If possible, will return the best available high value of the series for a given world coordinate.
member.param: The world coordinate for which to get the value for.
If true, interpolation should be used to get in-between values, rather than only the actual values in the data set.
If true, unknown values will be skipped when searching for a series value.
member.returns: The value in question, or double.NaN if no valid value is available.

Average period.

member.summary: Identifies the bindable property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.SeriesViewer.WindowRect
member.summary: A rectangle representing the portion of the SeriesViewer currently in view.
member.remarks: A rectangle at X=0, Y=0 with a Height and Width of 1 implies the entire plotting area is in view. A Height and Width of .5 would imply that the view is halfway zoomed in.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.SeriesViewer.WindowRectMinWidthProperty
member.summary: Identifies the bindable property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.SeriesViewer.WindowRectMinWidth
member.summary:
Sets or gets the minimum width that the window rect is allowed to reach before being clamped. Decrease this value if you want to allow for further zooming into the viewer. If this value is lowered too much it can cause graphical corruption due to floating point arithmetic inaccuracy.
This is a dependency property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.SeriesViewer.WindowResponseProperty
member.summary: Identifies the bindable property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.SeriesViewer.WindowResponse
member.summary: The response to user panning and zooming: whether to update the view immediately while the user action is happening, or to defer the update to after the user action is complete. The user action will be an action such as a mouse drag which causes panning and/or zooming to occur.

member.name: M:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.SeriesViewer.Flush
member.summary: Use to force the SeriesViewer to finish any deferred work before printing or evaluating its visual.
member.remarks: This should only be called if the visual of the SeriesViewer needs to be synchronously saved or evaluated. Calling this method too often will hinder the performance of the SeriesViewer.

member.name: M:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.PieChartBase.Flush
member.summary: Use to force the pie chart to finish any deferred work before printing or evaluating its visual.

member.name: M:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.PieChartBase.NotifyClearItems(System.Object)
member.summary: Manually notifies the pie chart's data source that the data it has bound to has been cleared and needs to be re-examined. This should not be called if the data that the pie chart is bound to is already observable.
member.param: The data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.PieChartBase.NotifyInsertItem(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Manually notifies the pie chart's data source that an item has been inserted in the data it is bound to. This should not be called if the data that the pie chart is bound to is already observable.
member.param: The data source.
The index of the inserted item.
The new item at the designated index.

member.name: M:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.PieChartBase.NotifyRemoveItem(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Manually notifies the pie chart's data source that an item has been removed in the data it is bound to. This should not be called if the data that the grid is bound to is already observable.
member.param: The data source.
The index of the removed item.
The old item at the designated index.

member.name: M:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.PieChartBase.NotifySetItem(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Manually notifies the pie chart's data source that an item has been changed in the data it is bound to. This should not be called the data that the pie chart is bound to is already observable.
member.param: The data source.
The index of the changed item.
The old item at the designated index.
The new item at the designated index.

member.name: T:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.AnnotationLayer
member.summary: Represents the base class for annotation layer types. Annotations will usually disable some of the default hover/touch behaviors of the chart when they are introduced to the series collection. In return they provide some valuable information as the cursor is moved by hovering over the chart, or performing a press-hold-drag interaction in touch mode.

member.name: M:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.AnnotationLayer.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs an annotation layer.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.AnnotationLayer.CursorPositionProperty
member.summary: Identifies the bindable property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.AnnotationLayer.CursorPosition
member.summary:
Gets or sets the world position to use instead of the pointer position for this annotation layer. If you set this value, rather than responding to the pointer, this layer will be fixed on the provided world position. A world position has x and y values that range from 0 to 1 that represent the global position of the cursor relative to the entire ranges of the axes. The default of (NaN, NaN) means that the layer should react to pointer movement.
This is a dependency property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.AnnotationLayer.IsDefaultCrosshairDisabledProperty

member.name: P:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.AnnotationLayer.IsDefaultCrosshairDisabled
member.summary:

This is a dependency property.

member.name: T:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.CategoryHighlightLayer
member.summary:
Represents an annotation layer that targets a category axis, or all category axes in the chart. If the axis contains any series that are aligned between major gridlines of the axis (column, waterfall, etc) this will render a shape that fills the current category. Otherwise it will render a band with an adjustable thickness at the closest gridline to the pointer position.
Setting UseIterpolation to true will cause the x position in the latter case to become affixed to the x position of the pointer.

member.name: M:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.CategoryHighlightLayer.#ctor

member.summary:

This is a dependency property.

member.summary: Identifies the bindable property.

member.summary:
Gets or sets the axis to target this annotation to. If null, this annotation targets all category axes simultaneously.

member.summary: Identifies the bindable property.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.CategoryItemHighlightLayer
member.summary:
Represents an annotation layer that highlights items in a series that use a category axis either by drawing a banded shape at their position, or by rendering a marker at their position.
Depending on the type of series, the default highlight will be affected. To override the type of highlight used, you can set the HighlightType property.

member.name: M:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.CategoryXAxis.ScrollRangeIntoView(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Scrolls the CategoryXAxis so that the provided range is brought into view.
member.param: The minimum category index to bring into view.
The maximum category index to bring into view.
member.remarks:
This method adjusts the WindowRect in order to scroll horizontally to the desired location. This means that the X axis zoom level may change as it tries to fit the minimum and maximum in view. It will not adjust the Y axis zoom level.
Note: The minimum and maximum are expected to be indexes referring to the items inside the CategoryXAxis ItemsSource.

member.name: T:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.ChartHitTestMode
member.summary: Describes available behaviors for performing hit testing in the chart/map.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.ChartHitTestMode.Auto
member.summary: Automatically decide the appropriate hit test mode for the content.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.ChartHitTestMode.Computational
member.summary: Use a computational based approach to determine which series has been hit. This uses loose bounding boxes, in some cases, and can range in time complexity between O(1) and O(log n) to find a hit. This decreases frame render time compared to color encoded.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.ChartHitTestMode.ColorEncoded
member.summary: Use a color encoded off screen buffer for hit testing. This can have extremely rare false positives where the wrong series is hit (this is due to our inability to disable anti-aliasing in our color buffer), but should always be O(1) time for determining a hit series. This increases frame render time, however. Consider using this if hit testing time is degrading performance.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.ChartHitTestMode.Mixed
member.summary: Let each series decide which hit testing mode to use individually based on their own hit test mode.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.ChartHitTestMode.MixedFavoringComputational
member.summary: Let each series decide which hit testing mode to use individually based on their own hit test mode, but evaluate all computational hits before evaluating any color encoding hits.

member.name: T:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.CollisionAvoidanceType
member.summary: Describes available methods of collision avoidance of series' markers.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.CollisionAvoidanceType.None
member.summary: Collision avoidance is disabled.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.CollisionAvoidanceType.Omit
member.summary: Items colliding with other items will be hidden from view.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.CollisionAvoidanceType.Fade
member.summary: Items colliding with other items will be partially hidden from view by reducing their opacity.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.CollisionAvoidanceType.OmitAndShift
member.summary: Items colliding with other items will be either hidden from view or moved to new positions.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.CollisionAvoidanceType.FadeAndShift
member.summary: Items colliding with other items will be either partially hidden from view by reducing their opacity, or moved to new positions, or a combination of both.

member.name: M:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.FinancialSeries.GetSeriesCloseValue(Xamarin.Forms.Point,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If possible, will return the best available close value of the series for a given world coordinate.
member.param: The world coordinate for which to get the value for.
If true, interpolation should be used to get in-between values, rather than only the actual values in the data set.
If true, unknown values will be skipped when searching for a series value.
member.returns: The value in question, or double.NaN if no valid value is available.

member.summary: If possible, will return the best available position within the series that has the best close value match for the world position provided.
member.param: The world coordinate for which to get a value position for
If true, interpolation should be used to get in-between values, rather than only the actual values in the data set.
If true, unknown values will be skipped when searching for a series value.
member.returns: The position in question, or NaN,NaN if no valid position is available.

member.summary: Financial indicator base class for doing calculating an itemwize indicator.

member.name: M:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.NumericXAxis.ScrollRangeIntoView(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Scrolls the NumericXAxis so that the provided range is brought into view.
member.param: The minimum value to bring into view.
The maximum value to bring into view.
member.remarks: This method adjusts the WindowRect in order to scroll horizontally to the desired location. This means that the X axis zoom level may change as it tries to fit the minimum and maximum in view. It will not adjust the Y axis zoom level.

member.param: The minimum value to bring into view.

member.remarks: This method adjusts the WindowRect in order to scroll vertically to the desired location. This means that the Y axis zoom level may change as it tries to fit the minimum and maximum in view. It will not adjust the X axis zoom level.

member.name: T:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.SeriesHitTestMode
member.summary: Describes available behaviors for performing hit testing in the chart/map.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.SeriesHitTestMode.Auto
member.summary: Automatically decide the appropriate hit test mode for the series.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.SeriesHitTestMode.Computational
member.summary: Use a computational based approach to determine whether the series has been hit. This uses loose bounding boxes, in some cases, and can range in time complexity between O(1) and O(log n) to find a hit. This decreases frame render time compared to color encoded.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.SeriesHitTestMode.ColorEncoded
member.summary: Use a color encoded off screen buffer for hit testing. Should always be O(1) time for determining a hit series. This increases frame render time and memory usage, however. Consider using this if hit testing time is degrading performance.

member.name: T:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.StrategyBasedIndicator
member.summary: A base class for indicator series with simple calculations that separates the calculation responsibility from the other responsibilities of the financial series, this enables easier unit testing and decoupling of individual calculation strategies.
member.remarks: A contract is defined between the financial series and these simple indicator calculations detailing the data which the series agrees to provide the simple indicator calculations, this contract is defined by . If more complex interactions are needed between the indicator calculation and the series, the indicators should instead derive from directly, or some derivative other than

member.name: T:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.TimeAxisDisplayType
member.summary: Describes available behaviors for displaying of gridlines, tickmarks, and labels on a time axis.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.TimeAxisDisplayType.Continuous
member.summary: Points occur at even intervals, even where data is not present at a given point.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.TimeAxisDisplayType.Discrete
member.summary: Points occur when data is present, possibly at uneven intervals.

member.name: T:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.TransitionInSpeedType
member.summary: Describes available types of speeds used when transitioning in a series.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.TransitionInSpeedType.Auto
member.summary: A speed type is automatically selected.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.TransitionInSpeedType.Normal
member.summary: All speeds are normal, data points will arrive at the same time.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.TransitionInSpeedType.ValueScaled
member.summary: Data points will arrive later if their value is further from the start point.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.TransitionInSpeedType.IndexScaled
member.summary: Data points will arrive later if their index is further from the axis origin.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XamarinForms.Controls.Charts.TransitionInSpeedType.Random
member.summary: Data points will arrive at random times.
